summary: "...And Justice for All" is Metallica's fourth album, released in 1988. It's their first with bassist Jason Newsted after Cliff Burton's death. The album has complex songs with political and legal themes. The cover shows Lady Justice tied up and weighed down by money. It was well-liked by critics but lost a Grammy to Jethro Tull. The song "One" won a Grammy and the album was very popular, selling eight million copies in the U.S. It was reissued in 2018 with extra content.
title: ...And Justice for All (album)
